title: How to write multiple voices speaking at once - Quora

response.answer_text: I've pondered this, too. Your can weave snippets of conversation into a linear narrative, like “You wouldn't believe—” “—totally floored me! It seems—” “—not Mabel and George? Was—” “—Edwin saw it all from—“ “—out in the street—”. Or you could be really daring and present it typographically, like in separate columns, or with paragraphs scattered all over the page.
Normally, you can do as Milo described, or simply say, Everyone started talking at once. As long as you get the point across. You want to skip to the next important thing.
